chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A. Kipfer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was granted credit for 146 days served. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.

Defendant is to have a Psychological evaluation complying with the recommendations releasing all records to the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to comply with a sex offender assessment and follow the recomendations releasing all records to the agent.

Defendant is to comply with the Sex Offender Registry Requirements

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. 

 Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. 

 The defendant shall have no contact with the victim E.A.K. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Defendant is not to have any contact with persons under the age of 18 including family members without the prior permission of the agent AND then only supervised contact.  Contact defined as in site or sound of person and supervision defined as 25 year old adult with in site and sound of defendant and anyone under the age of 18.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Cr 240 and 241 sent to all victims.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Andrew A. Kipfer, appeared with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse and Attorney Peter Wolff. Defense presents character witnesses.PSI received by all parties.
Sentencing hearing on October 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Andrew A. Kipfer, appeared with Attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse. Plea entered, PSI ordered. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count 1, remaining counts are dismissed and read-in. Defense requests reduction of bond, State objects and requests bond revoked and remand of defendant. Court denies request to amend bond .
Status conference on July 31, 2014 at 09:40 am.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Sonderhouse appearing telephonically in court requesting additional status  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 09:40 am.
to parents/guardians of assualt

Status conference on June 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Sonderhouse  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information  Waived reading of Information  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY. Defense requesting lower cash bail or high signature bond. State objects to signature bond or lowering cash bond.  Court denies request.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Sonderhouse  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Preliminary hearing waived.
Original Bond that was subsequently corrected returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Cash Bond, corrected due to clerk's error to $50,000.00
Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender Representation.
Initial appearance on May 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with E.K., M.H. or K.N.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way he is also not to have any contact with females 16 and under, except incidentally at public places

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
